feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud DNS
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud DNS

entry.content:
Alias records are available in GA.

This custom record type provides CNAME-like functionality at the zone apex, mapping the apex domain name to a canonical target.
entry.summary: Alias records are now available in Google Cloud. This feature provides CNAME-like functionality at the zone apex, mapping the apex domain name to a canonical target.
entry.title: Feature: Alias Records Now Generally Available

entry.content:
Monitoring your internet-bound DNS queries for malicious activity using advanced threat detection from DNS Armor is now available in Preview.

For more information, see Advanced threat detection overview.
entry.summary: Monitor your internet-bound DNS queries for malicious activity with DNS Armor's advanced threat detection, now available in preview.
entry.title: Feature: DNS Armor now in preview

entry.content:
DNS64 is available in GA.

DNS64 provides synthesized IPv6 addresses for IPv4 destinations. For more information, see the following:

  • DNS64 overview
  • Configure DNS64 server policies
entry.summary: The DNS64 feature is now generally available, allowing for synthesized IPv6 addresses for IPv4 destinations.
entry.title: Feature: DNS64 now generally available

entry.content: Using a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) forwarding target is available for outbound DNS forwarding in GA.
entry.summary: You can now use a fully qualified domain name for outbound DNS forwarding in Google Cloud. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: FQDN Support for Outbound DNS Forwarding
